title: How to Make Potato Bacon Soup

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a pot over medium heat until fully melted.
Add in the onions and mix with a wooden spoon until lightly browned.
Mix in the salt, pepper, potatoes, water, and dill weed.
Place to heat onto a boil for about 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to a simmer until the potatoes are tender, taking about 30 minutes.
Pour in the milk and bacon bits, bringing the heat to a boil.
Add the parsley to the soup.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the potato bacon soup into serving bowls  Sprinkle extra bacon bits if desired. Enjoy!

text: Melt the butter in a pot over medium heat until fully melted.  Add in the onions and mix with a wooden spoon until lightly browned. Cook for about 10 minutes. Mix in the salt, pepper, potatoes, water, and dill weed.  Place to heat onto a boil for about 10 minutes.  Reduce the heat to a simmer until the potatoes are tender, taking about 30 minutes.  Pour in the milk and bacon bits, bringing the heat to a boil.  Shut off the stove.  Add the parsley to the soup.  Serve. Scoop the potato bacon soup into serving bowls  Sprinkle extra bacon bits if desired. Enjoy!
